intro: Cousinia thamnodes, commonly known as the mountain cudweed, is a flowering plant native to the high mountain regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in rocky and arid environments, showcasing adaptations to harsh, high-altitude conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and hairy, helping to reduce water loss in dry climates. Cousinia thamnodes produces small yellow flowers that bloom in the summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
